title: Compliments
description: Use these phrases to give someone a compliment, or show admiration.

conversation: I really like your shoes!
Thanks! They are new.
Where did you get them?
I got them at the mall last week.
conversations.title: I really like your __.

conversation: Thanks for inviting me to your home. What a lovely apartment!
Thank you! it’s pretty small, but I like it.
Well, I really like how you decorated it.
conversations.title: What a lovely __!

conversation: Nice drawing!
Thanks! I drew it in art class today.
It’s beautiful. Do you want to hang it on the fridge?
conversations.title: Nice __!

conversation: You did a great job on your science project!
I did?
Yes, your teacher said it was one of the best.
Wow, thanks!
conversations.title: You did a great job...

conversation: That’s a nice blouse you’re wearing.
Thanks! I like yours too.
Thank you! It was a birthday gift from my sister.
conversations.title: That’s a nice __.

conversation: Your dress is beautiful.
Oh, do you think so? It’s pretty old.
Yes, that color looks great on you.
Thanks! I like the color too.
conversations.title: Your __ is beautiful.

conversation: Thanks for picking up my kids today!
No problem! They were great.
You are so kind. I really appreciate it.
Not a problem. I hope you have a good day!
conversations.title: You are so __.

conversation: You look nice today!
Thanks! I have an interview this afternoon.
I’m sure you’ll do great. Good luck!
Thank you!
conversations.title: You look nice today.

conversations.usage: Tell someone they are good at something.
conversation: Wow, this meal is delicious!
Thank you!
You are a great cook!
Thanks, you are too kind. I’m glad you like it!
conversations.title: You are a great __.
